sn12.50:1.2: “Mendicants, a learned noble disciple doesn’t think:
sn12.50:1.3: ‘When what exists, what is? Due to the arising of what, what arises?
sn12.50:1.4: When what exists do choices come to be? When what exists does consciousness come to be? When what exists do name and form … the six sense fields … contact … feeling … craving … grasping … continued existence … rebirth … old age and death come to be?’
sn12.50:2.1: Rather, a learned noble disciple has only knowledge about this that is independent of others:
sn12.50:2.2: ‘When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
sn12.50:2.3: When ignorance exists, choices come to be.
sn12.50:2.4: When choices exist consciousness comes to be.
sn12.50:2.5: When consciousness exists name and form come to be.
sn12.50:2.6: When name and form exist the six sense fields come to be.
sn12.50:2.7: When the six sense fields exist contact comes to be.
sn12.50:2.8: When contact exists feeling comes to be.
sn12.50:2.9: When feeling exists craving comes to be.
sn12.50:2.10: When craving exists grasping comes to be.
sn12.50:2.11: When grasping exists continued existence comes to be.
sn12.50:2.12: When continued existence exists rebirth comes to be.
sn12.50:2.13: When rebirth exists old age and death come to be.’
sn12.50:2.15: ‘This is the origin of the world.’
sn12.50:3.1: A learned noble disciple doesn’t think:
sn12.50:3.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist, what is not? Due to the cessation of what, what ceases?
sn12.50:3.3: When what doesn’t exist do choices not come to be? When what doesn’t exist does consciousness not come to be? When what doesn’t exist do name and form … the six sense fields … contact … feeling … craving … grasping … continued existence … rebirth … old age and death not come to be?’
sn12.50:4.1: Rather, a learned noble disciple has only knowledge about this that is independent of others:
sn12.50:4.2: ‘When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
sn12.50:4.3: When ignorance doesn’t exists, choices don’t come to be.
sn12.50:4.4: When choices don’t exist consciousness doesn’t come to be.
sn12.50:4.5: When consciousness doesn’t exist name and form don’t come to be.
sn12.50:4.6: When name and form don’t exist the six sense fields don’t come to be. …
sn12.50:4.7: When rebirth doesn’t exist old age and death don’t come to be.’
sn12.50:4.9: ‘This is the cessation of the world.’
sn12.50:5.1: A noble disciple comes to understand the world, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation. Such a noble disciple is called ‘one accomplished in view’, ‘one accomplished in vision’, ‘one who has come to the true teaching’, ‘one who sees this true teaching’, ‘one endowed with a trainee’s knowledge’, ‘one who has entered the stream of the teaching’, ‘a noble one with penetrative wisdom’, and ‘one who stands pushing open the door of the deathless’.”
